metadata.Title: CVE-2019-8383 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in AdvanceCOMP through 2.1. An invalid memory address occurs in the function adv_png_unfilter_8 in lib/png.c. It can be triggered by sending a crafted file to a binary. It allows an attacker to cause a Denial of Service (Segmentation fault) or possibly have unspecified other impact when a victim opens a specially crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8383` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

advancecomp - 2.1-1ubuntu0.18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: advancecomp package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1-1ubuntu0.18.04.2').
